title-group.article-title: Low Price Stocks and the January Effect

abstract.p: This study explores the role of per share price in identifying stocks particularly likely to outperform the market in January. It is found that low price stocks that exhibited poor December performance were likely to rebound in January. This tendency was observed annually for the 1971-1983 sample, as well as for the 1984 holdout sample. Similar results were obtained with or without risk adjustment.
